intro: Oxalis lunulata, commonly known as the moon-leaf oxalis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves, which have a pale greenish-white color with a prominent white or cream-colored central lobe. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or red, with five petals and a spurred structure. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun exposure. Oxalis lunulata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
